CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 2, reads: "'Brother's Keeper' Awards Awards of U.S. Savings Bonds for their unselfish service to two respective infants who were not of the same race as their benefactor in either case, Mayor David L. Lawrence makes a presentation in behalf of Local 609, Refuse Workers Unit of the Teamsters Union, to Patrolman George Neff, second from left, of Centre Ave. Police Station, who literally breathed his own breath into a dying Negro tot to save his life on the way to the hospital in a police ambulance; and to Robert Saunders, 508 Wicklow St., refuse worker who found a newborn white baby suffering from exposure in a rubbish barrel and rushed it to the hospital to save its life. Second from right is Theodore Brown, business agent of Local 609, and far right, Theodore Johnson, president of the City Refuse Workers local, which granted the awards. - Harris Photo."image published by Pittsburgh Courier with Theodore Brown masked and Robert Saunders and Theodore Brown from image 2001.35.46732 added.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence presenting savings bonds to Patrolman George Neff, Theodore Brown, and Theodore Johnson, in Office of the Mayor, City County Building
